about_the_game:
101010 is a simple VR puzzle game created as a class project for CS 498 VR at UIUC to help showcase the capabilities of VR. Place 3D blocks in virtual reality and clear lines to earn points. How long can you last? How high of a score can you earn?

Features

  • Grab 3D blocks in virtual reality with your own hands.
  • Place blocks strategically in a 3D grid.
  • Clear lines to earn points (both horizontally and vertically).
  • Rotate the grid if you wish.
  • You are given a constant amount of time to place each block, so don't dawdle!
  • If you do not successfully place a block in time, it's game over.
  • Develops spatial ability, visual memory, and quick thinking.

Designed for use with Occulus Rift. Inspired by the game 1010. Created by Eric Shen, Miranda Li, Hunter Ha Huynh, Changcheng Fu, and Jenny Chen.

Designed for use with Occulus Rift. Inspired by the game 1010. Created by Eric Shen, Miranda Li, Hunter Ha Huynh, Changcheng Fu, and Jenny Chen.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4590 or equivalent
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 960 or equivalent
  • Storage: 150 MB available space
  • VR Support: Oculus PC
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel i5-4590 or equivalent
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 1060 or equivalent
  • Storage: 150 MB available space

short_description: A simple puzzle game. Place 3D blocks in virtual reality and clear lines to earn points. How high of a score can you earn?
